reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night at Kincraig and two nights at their sister hotel on Skye.Both hotels were exceptionally clean,fantastic food and great staff.The premier room we had at Kincraig was very large and had a great view over the front garden.The bathroom had a large corner bath and was very modern and spotlessly clean.Would definitely return to either hotel and would highly recommend both.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My work means I stay in a large number of hotels in a great many countries and I have to say this is my favourite Scottish hotel. The rooms are huge and well furnished much better than the big chains can offer.
reviews.title: Stay here

reviews.text: Also the food is delicious and the staff do go out of their way to make you feel welcome. If your visiting the area stay here you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Huge Bedrooms, great value for money

reviews.text: I stayed at this wonderful, Peaceful and well Located hotel in June-08 for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Magnifique!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very easy to be found as registered by the National Scotland Trust so you can just follow the signs.
reviews.title: not for weddings

reviews.text: As soon as you arrive, the first impression is the calm and rest feeling given by the all area. And them come the personnel: very friendly, polite. I was welcome and automatically identified as i was the last guess to check in, which made my welcome personalised. The food is superb (see the pictures self explainable). The room is spacious and VERY CLEAN. That’s one f the place where you totally forget the stress of work/life.
reviews.title: An excellent choice

likes.liked: — Overall high standards; efficient wireless broadband service

reviews.text: we have stayed at the hotel on several occassions and had our wedding booked at this hotel for some time- the manager in charge decided to change all kind of aspects of what was agreed and doubled the prices!
reviews.title: Not Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice but the staff are not as friendly as expected.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay.

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are excellent and every request is dealt with by their staff. The house staff are always happy and helpful. Very charming and peaceful. Well worth the visit. The dinner service is well above standard, the food is delightful and the whiskey choice is warming.
reviews.title: Kincraig Castle Hotel

reviews.text: I will definately come back to this charming hotel again as i was made very welcome from the moment i arrived until the moment i departed.
reviews.title: Peaceful and Professional

reviews.text: This hotel is unashamedly "old-fashioned" but does not pretend to be anything else! Decor refelcts the grandeur of this old-house - was a wee bit of luxury in a busy world. I had spent the previous 3 nights in Aberdeen - and so was fabulous to truly relax prior to my meeting the morning following my visit. Unfortunately whisky is wasted on me - which is a shame since the variety behind the bar was quite something - and the staff all seemed knowledgeable and very able to assist any enquiries from those partaking in the John Barleycorn. All staff very warm and couldn't do enough! Meal was lovely (felt like having a "plain-old steak" - and was exactly as asked for! Will be back!
reviews.title: Xmas day lunch

reviews.text: We were welcomed on arrival and shown straight to our table. The table was beautifully presented. Lovely xmas lunch menu with a good range of choice. I was disappointed that the bread rolls on the table did not appear to be homemade and they were cold. Our food and drinks order was promptly taken and starter arrived very quickly. My partner and daughter both had the smoked salmon and cream cheese parcels and my partner thought his starter was exceptional. I had the melon and red jelly terrine, the melon was tasteless and it was not a great combination but it was pleasant enough for a starter. There was a sorbet inbetween the starter and main again we all though this was exceptional. Main course we all ordered turkey, one without chestnuts as our daughter has a nut allergy. The main course arrived but the shared vegetables had a coating of nuts and so we were asked if we wanted them changed, bit odd considering we had ordered one portion without nuts due to an allergy, bit of a wait to get fresh nut free veg. Pudding we had xmas pudding and it was lovely. After dinner we sat by the fire in the lounge and enjoyed mince pies and fresh coffee. Overall though we had a throughly fine time, we have been to Kincraig in the past for xmas day lunch and would go back again next year.
reviews.title: Lovely highland hotel

reviews.text: Great setting big traditional rooms. Porridge was lovely and a huge helping. Eggs Benedict to die for !! Visited on business but would definitely go back on holiday. Very friendly and helpful staff and a friendly welcome from local people. I really liked this hotel.
reviews.title: very nice
A hidden gem - amazing dinner
reviews.text: Lovely old country house hotel - don't let slightly run-down outside put you off as it is beautiful inside. Room spotless with just the right kind of accessories in keeping with the time period. Very spacious too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lounge arge and comfortable with everyone making you feel very welcome.
reviews.title: A great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was outstanding - amuse bouche, soup, starter, main, sorbet and dessert finished off with coffee and tablet. The cheese souffle with poached egg was amazing. Service unobtrusive, yet efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Recent visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, our stay was spoilt a little by a chaotic breakfast service. Scrambled eggs with smoked salmon as I have never had before (or want again) - more lke a very dry omelette. My husband's order was wrong and we waited almost 20 minutes for our tea and toast to finally arrive. Meanwhile, a young girl wandered about trying to find out who had ordered a potato scone that she had "forgotten."
reviews.title: Lovely place for a break from the routine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we had not had dinner the previous night this review would be very different if only based on the breakfast.However, the dinner was amazing and this hotel is well worth a visit if you like good food.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel & great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I went here for a romantic break. We were met by the friendliest of staff upon our arrival. We arrived as meals had finished, but the staff could not be more accommodating in making sure we were fed. Nothing was too much for them. We highly praise the manager David Sinclair for his dedication and ensuring the hotel has the highest of standards. We ate in the main restaurant each night. All I can say is that is the best food I have ever eaten. Gordon Ramsey could learn a thing or two!! The room was massive and so comfortable, and had the biggest bathroom. The area has some of the best views around. Ask the staff for advice where to go and they are happy to advise. It was a pleasure staying here at Kingraig and we will be back. A very worthy four star hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic! A must

reviews.text: Booked the hotel as venue for my wifes 60th birthday party, had a great night they really made us feel very welcome. We had about 20 guests for a meal and a few more for drinks later on. The meal was excellent and served by cheery staff, the tables were festooned with party ballons,poppers and crackers nothing was too much trouble for them. The only slight downside was that later in the night the bar seemed to run out of clean cold glasses perhaps due to inexperienced barstaff and in fairness it was a busy night.
reviews.title: Birthday Party

likes.disliked: — Warm Gass for my spiced rum

reviews.text: Some of us stayed overnight and had an excellent breakfast served by a very pleasant waitress
reviews.title: Average 3 star Hotel

likes.disliked: — No residents lounge, poor staff training, poor location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was really spacious with a beautiful bathroom and very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had a very pleasant time at Kincraig.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful large house , not really a true castle but nevertheless a lovely building in large attractive grounds a long way back from the road . Very well appointed public rooms and the bedroom we had was enormous and very nicely furnished with great views to the front of the property ( no 23) lovely big bathroom with nice toiletries . Fruit, biscuits , petits fours , tea/coffee and fizzy water were all provided in the room
reviews.title: Excellent traditional country house hotel

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly, food was excellent with a choice of fine dining or bar suppers. Breakfast was good too
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel with very good restauarant

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend
reviews.title: Whats in a name?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel will suit travellers heading north from Inverness. It is an old country house style property well maintained, clean and warm. Rooms are comfortable and bathrooms clean. Shower was good.
reviews.title: Oh dear!

reviews.text: Had dinner in the restaurant and the food was very good. Service was polite and friendly and some very good views from the restuarant windows.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: We just got married at Kincraig Castle Hotel on 29/04/13. All we can say is what a perfect venue it was.
reviews.title: The perfect Wedding

reviews.text: We were looking for an intimate venue for our party of 12 and it was perfect. We stayed over on the Sunday evening and had a meal in the Bar with a relaxing evening in the lounge sampling a few of the fine whiskeys - Dalmore recommended!
reviews.title: Overrated and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was delicious and the staff attentive and friendly at all times.
reviews.title: Best value Sunday lunch in Scotland

reviews.text: The day of the Wedding started with a delicious and beautifully presented full Scottish breakfast, plenty of coffee and toast with fantastic views of the Cromarty Firth and lanscaped gardens.
reviews.title: Lovely Homely Welcoming Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast for the Bride was served in the room, we took the Castle rooms and room 21 on the middle floor and two rooms on the upper floor all of which are lovely rooms with gorgeous views.
reviews.title: Sorry to be leaving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew of Kincraig House from 30 years ago but had never previously stayed here. It's been recently renovated to a very good standard. Our room, which was large, well-appointed, clean and comfortable, was at the back of the house with views over the service courtyard. However, rooms at the front have stunning views. The house is located above the Cromarty Firth and the dining room, reception room, bar and front bedrooms all also enjoy wonderful views of the Black Isle.
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend

reviews.text: We ate our dinners in the bar. The food was tasty and good value. In addition, our cooked breakfast of fresh kipper and scrambled eggs, served in the dining room, was excellent. Alongside we had a selection of foods from the cold buffet.
reviews.title: Average.......just

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service in both the bar and the dining room was very friendly. We never waited long for our orders to be fulfilled.
reviews.title: Fabby
Top Class Wedding Venue
reviews.text: We enjoyed our weekend at the hotel very much and do not hesitate to recommend it to others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there during the cold weather in early Jan.
reviews.title: Amazing!
